Selected Answer: A
Allocating resources has already taken place.

Selected Answer: A
Resource loading is a process used in project management that fills team members' total available time with assignments throughout a workweek. Project managers typically assign team members a percentage of a project or objective per day until they reach 100% of their weekly work capacity.

Resource allocation is the process of assigning the best available resources to tasks and projects. Resource loading, an employee will typically be assigned a percentage of a project, and can then be assigned additional project percentages until that employee reaches 100% of their hourly work week capacity.
Resource loading in project management is the process of loading employees‚Äô total available hours with assignments. That's the next logical step to me

questions.question_text: A team member was replaced on a project by a new team member of equal capability. Which of the following should the project manager do FIRST?

choices.B: The project manager has no authority over the project resources and limited-to-no authority over the project.
choices.A: The project manager has full authority over resources and the project.
choices.C: Resources align to the project, report to the project manager, and have no functional home at the end of the project.
choices.D: Resources report to business area functional managers and return to the functional area at the end of the project.
